title: 109_hr2048
content: The Act titled "Motor Vehicle Owners' Right to Repair Act of 2005" aims to ensure the rights of motor vehicle owners. The Act "Motor Vehicle Owners' Right to Repair Act of 2005" emphasizes the importance of timely, reliable, and affordable diagnosis, service, and repair of motor vehicles for consumer safety. It also highlights the right of consumers to choose among competing repair facilities. Increased competition among repair facilities is seen as beneficial for vehicle owners. Additionally, the use of computers in various vehicle systems is on the rise. The Motor Vehicle Owners' Right to Repair Act of 2005 stresses the importance of timely, reliable, and affordable diagnosis, service, and repair of modern motor vehicles. Access codes often hinder owners from accessing necessary information for vehicle maintenance, leading to restricted competition among repair facilities. Consumers in the US benefit from a competitive aftermarket industry for vehicle parts and accessories. The Motor Vehicle Owners' Right to Repair Act of 2005 emphasizes the rights of vehicle owners in the US to access information, choose between original and aftermarket parts, and make necessary repairs to maintain their vehicles. This act aims to prevent restrictions on repair information and tools that limit who can repair vehicles and what parts can be used. The Motor Vehicle Owners' Right to Repair Act of 2005 aims to ensure vehicle owners have access to necessary repair information and parts, promote competition in vehicle repair, and reduce costs for consumers. The Motor Vehicle Owners' Right to Repair Act of 2005 aims to ensure vehicle owners have access to necessary repair information and parts, promote competition in vehicle repair, and reduce costs for consumers. Manufacturer disclosure requirements are outlined in Section 3 of the Act. The Motor Vehicle Owners' Right to Repair Act of 2005 mandates manufacturers to promptly provide vehicle owners or repair facilities with necessary information for diagnosing, servicing, or repairing vehicles. This includes non-emission-related service information, training information, and diagnostic tools on a non-discriminatory basis. Independent repair facilities must have access to the same service and training information as franchised dealerships. The Motor Vehicle Owners' Right to Repair Act of 2005 requires manufacturers to provide independent repair facilities with the same diagnostic tools and capabilities as franchised dealerships. This information must be available for purchase by vehicle owners or their agents through reasonable means, without the need to return to a franchised dealership. The Motor Vehicle Owners' Right to Repair Act of 2005 ensures that manufacturers must provide repair information to independent facilities, without withholding necessary details for vehicle repairs. Trade secrets and exclusive design information are protected from public disclosure. The Motor Vehicle Owners' Right to Repair Act of 2005 mandates that manufacturers must provide repair information to independent facilities within one year of enactment. The Federal Trade Commission will set regulations for manufacturers to disclose this information, effective for vehicles made after 1994. The regulations must not conflict with the Environmental Protection Agency's rules on motor vehicle emissions control diagnostics systems. Enforcement provisions are also included in the Act. The Motor Vehicle Owners' Right to Repair Act of 2005 requires manufacturers to provide repair information to independent facilities. Failure to comply will be considered an unfair or deceptive act in commerce. The Federal Trade Commission will enforce the Act in the same manner as the Federal Trade Commission Act. The Act incorporates penalties and privileges from the Federal Trade Commission Act for violations. It does not limit the authority of the Federal Trade Commission under other laws. SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS. This section defines key terms such as "manufacturer", "motor vehicle", "motor vehicle equipment", "motor vehicle owner", "vehicle owner", and "repair facility".
